1.title: Toilet Paper Orientation

episode of.title: The Things You Learn on Wikipedia (TV Series 2014–2015)

1.plot: Should toilet paper hang OVER or UNDER the roll? It's a topic that may seem inconsequential, but stirs passions, prompts scientific debate--and is deemed worthy of its own Wikipedia page.

2.title: Three Wolf Moon

episode of.title: The Things You Learn on Wikipedia (TV Series 2014–2015)

2.plot: Three Wolf Moon is more than just a T-shirt. It's a customer review comedy legend. It's an Amazon bestseller. It's an internet meme. It's even got its own Wikipedia page.

3.title: Calculator Spelling

episode of.title: The Things You Learn on Wikipedia (TV Series 2014–2015)

3.plot: When pocket calculators first appeared in the 1970s, it didn't take long for schoolboys, mathematicians and comedians to realize that certain numbers, when read upside down, resembled letters of the alphabet.

4.title: Monowi, Nebraska

episode of.title: The Things You Learn on Wikipedia (TV Series 2014–2015)

4.plot: Monowi, Nebraska is the only incorporated municipality in the USA with a population of one. Find out how Elsie Eiler keeps the town on the map by acting as Mayor, Tavern Owner and sole Taxpayer.

5.title: The Ig Nobel Prize

episode of.title: The Things You Learn on Wikipedia (TV Series 2014–2015)

5.plot: Organized by the magazine Annals of Improbable Research, The Ig Nobel Prizes are a parody of the Nobel Prizes that each year honor some of the world's most weird and wonderful scientific research.

imdb.title: The Things You Learn on Wikipedia
akas: The Things You Learn on Wikipedia (United States)
plot: Arthur Albert (TV Land's "Forever Young") takes viewers on a tour of Wikipedia's wackiest entries, from the controversial topic of "Toilet Paper Orientation" to the tale of the viral, pop-culture phenomenon of "Three Wolf Moon," and more.::Richard Hine
